DOCNAME: CASE OF ABDULSAMET YAMAN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Art. 3;Violation of Art. 13;Violation of Art. 5-3;Violation of Art. 5-4;Violation of Art. 5-5;No violation of Art. 14;No violation of Art. 18;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and was detained in the GPE prison in GPE at the time of the application . In DATE he went to GPE and sought asylum . He currently lives in GPE . He was the provincial leader of ORG ) in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was taken into custody by police officers from ORG . He alleges that he was blindfolded , put in a car , beaten and threatened . After being driven around for some time , still blindfolded , he was taken to ORG . The applicant claims that he did not realise that the persons who had abducted him were police officers and that the building to which he had been taken was ORG .

CARDINAL . The applicant further alleges that he was blindfolded , stripped naked and immersed in cold water in ORG . He was attached by the arms to the ceiling pipes and made to stand on a chair . Electric cables were attached to his body , in particular to his sexual organs . The chair was then pulled away and he was left suspended while electric shocks were administered . From time to time the shocks were stopped and his testicles were squeezed . The applicant was interrogated about his work and his connections with an illegal organisation , the ORG ( ORG ORG ) . He was further questioned as to why he had helped torture victims apply to ORG .

CARDINAL . DATE the applicant was detained in ORG . The applicant alleges that his family had not been informed of his detention and that the interrogation under torture continued during this DATE period .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a medical expert from ORG . The applicant stated that - as a result of the torture – he did not have the full use of his left arm , CARDINAL of his ribs had been broken and there were injuries to various parts of his body on account of having been attached and suspended . The forensic medical expert 's report stated the following :
“ QUANTITY superficial scab wounds were identified on the right knee of the person and inside both wrists . The person described numbness in his left arm and pain in the right side of his chest . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought before the ORG public prosecutor and then before ORG ( Sulh Ceza Mahkemesi ) . On both occasions the applicant denied the veracity of the statements that had been taken from him by the police . ORG ordered his detention on remand . He alleges that on the way from the courthouse to the ORG prison he was ill - treated by the policemen accompanying him , who used rifle butts and truncheons to beat him .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was brought to the sickbay of the prison and examined by Dr. PERSON who noted the following in the prison patients ' examination book :

“ He claims to have been subjected to duress in ORG . He further alleges that he was beaten up between the courthouse and the prison . There are bruises of QUANTITY on the upper left arm , numerous erythematic and some ecchymosed lesions on the back . There are lesions , i.e. scratches and grazes , on the right ankle . ”
CARDINAL . The applicant claims that Dr. PERSON advised him to obtain permission from the prison authorities to be transferred to a hospital for treatment .

CARDINAL . The applicant further claims that he submitted petitions to the ORG public prosecutor 's office through the prison authorities on CARDINAL , CARDINAL and DATE , requesting that he be given permission to be treated at the hospital and that he be sent to ORG for a further medical examination . He contends that no action was taken on his requests and that the prison administration did not permit him to see a doctor from ORG who had come to the prison to inquire about his situation .
CARDINAL . On unspecified dates the applicant was transferred from the ORG prison to the GPE prison and from the latter to the PERSON prison . In DATE the applicant was released pending trial .

CARDINAL . On DATE a doctor from the Rehabilitation and Research Centre for Torture Victims in GPE commented on the medical procedures used to examine the applicant . She stated that , following a lapse of time , it was difficult to see any marks on the body after electrical torture . However , it was possible to observe a superficial lesion on the skin in the acute phase on a minority of victims . She further stated that exposure to cold water did not necessarily cause pneumonia , fever or soreness of the throat . She maintained that numbness , pain or reduced strength in the arms were symptoms of suspension by the arms . She finally stated that scab formations on the wrists were often seen when the wrists were tied together tightly for a period of time .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor from the ORG branch of ORG of GPE . According to the doctor 's report , the applicant 's symptoms included pain in the gums , inability to eat due to missing teeth , pain in the chest and pain and restricted movement in the wrists and knees . The applicant further contracted pleurisy ( inflammation of the pleura ) which necessitated surgical treatment . As to the reasons for the applicant 's poor state of health , the report referred to his illtreatment and the prison conditions .
CARDINAL . In DATE the applicant arrived in GPE where he claimed asylum . On DATE he was granted a residence permit in GPE .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor in GPE . The doctor noted the following symptoms : chronic pain in the feet , knees and femur ; dyspnoea ( breathing difficulties ) ; depression ; and reduced pulmonary functioning . The doctor concluded that it could not be excluded that the applicant 's complaints were the result of torture . He further noted that the applicant would receive somatic and psychological treatment at his surgery .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was examined by a doctor working in ORG , an organisation based in GPE specialised in providing advice and treatment to refugees and torture victims . The doctor , after referring to the somatic and psychological findings consistent with the report of DATE , diagnosed the applicant as suffering from chronic post - traumatic stress syndrome . He further stated that the applicant was also suffering from serious psychosomatic problems .
CARDINAL . On an unspecified date the ORG public prosecutor issued a decision of non - jurisdiction and sent the applicant 's case file and the case files of CARDINAL other defendants to ORG .

CARDINAL . On an unspecified date , the applicant 's case file was transferred to ORG .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG convicted the applicant under LAW of aiding and abetting the members of the ORG and sentenced him to DATE and DATE imprisonment .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG upheld the judgment of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant filed a complaint with the public prosecutor 's office in GPE alleging that he had been ill - treated during his detention in police custody .

CARDINAL . On DATE , following a preliminary investigation against CARDINAL police officers from ORG , the ORG public prosecutor declined to take criminal proceedings against the officers due to lack of evidence against them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the International Law and ORG of ORG sent a letter to the chief public prosecutor 's office in GPE requesting the latter to conduct an investigation into the allegations which the applicant had filed with ORG .

CARDINAL . DATE , the ORG chief public prosecutor 's office conducted a new preliminary investigation into the applicant 's allegations of ill - treatment . The applicant was heard in the context of this investigation . He gave the names of CARDINAL witnesses on his behalf . The ORG public prosecutor heard CARDINAL of these witnesses , who confirmed the applicant 's allegations . The public prosecutor heard the accused police officers , who denied the allegations against them .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor filed a bill of indictment with ORG ( Ağır Ceza Mahkemesi ) , charging CARDINAL police officers , who had been on duty in ORG at the time of the alleged ill - treatment of the applicant , under LAW . The defendants were accused of torturing the applicant in order to obtain a confession from him .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , ORG held CARDINAL hearings in the case against the police officers .

CARDINAL . The court heard the evidence of the accused and some of the witnesses until DATE . On DATE , the court abandoned the proposal to hear the applicant and CARDINAL witnesses . It held that the statements which they had given during the preliminary investigation were sufficient and observed that they could not be found .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG withdrew its decision of DATE in relation to the applicant on the ground that he could probably be summoned to give evidence before the court since he had filed an application with ORG . The firstinstance court issued a further summons requiring the applicant to give evidence .
CARDINAL . The applicant 's whereabouts could not be determined until DATE .
